intro: Ochrocarpos planchonianus, commonly known as the Planchon's ochrocarp, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying tropical flora.
